title: Pregnant mum loses baby after being shot by an intruder
text:
"I felt an intense pain in my stomach - I could barely walk. I begged for someone to help me."

How to deal with the loss of a family member or someone you loved. Some helpful tips on how to navigate through life when you loose someone close to you.

How to deal with grief and the loss of a loved one 00:20:39

Desire was folding baby clothes when she heard the splintering sound of her door being kicked in.

Instinctively, the pregnant American mum froze, unable to believe that someone had just broken into her home.

It wasn’t until she heard a man’s voice calling her name that she realised that this wasn’t an ordinary robbery.

Desire crept out of the bedroom silently – but the woman with a knife soon found her.

“She quickly grabbed hold of me,” Desire first wrote on Love What Matters.

“I begged and pleaded for her not to stab me. ‘I’m pregnant!’”

“There, in the living room, stood a man holding a gun to my boyfriend’s head.”

Desire was just 21 when she fell pregnant. Source: Desire Guardiola

“I was so excited to be a mother!”

In early 2019, Desire had realised that her period was late – but it wasn’t until the second pregnancy test that reality sunk in.

Her baby’s father was in rehab by then, but Desire couldn’t help but think that the baby was a sign.

“I believed God sent her to me to save me and make me feel like I had a purpose - being to love and nurture this child,” she said.

“I hoped and prayed she would be healthy and that I’d be able to give her a great life.

“I was so overwhelmed with emotions and thoughts.

“I was so excited to be a mother!”

Desire couldn't wait to meet her baby girl. Source: Desire Guardiola

"They told me to shut up and stop moving"

Now, less than seven months later, Desire felt utterly terrified that her baby was in danger.

The armed man and woman had broken into her home because of an issue with her boyfriend at the time (who wasn’t her baby’s father).

Although she begged them to leave her alone - the pair wouldn't listen.

“After a while of being told to shut up and stop moving, and being threatened to be shot and stabbed, they angrily grabbed our phones, my car keys, all my cards and belongings in my purse," she said.

“In it included all the money I had been saving for emergencies and for Emery."

Desire desperately needed that money for her baby girl so she raced out of the house screaming for help.

Her then-partner chased the couple and managed to tackle them to the ground.

Desire was seven months pregnant at the time. Source: Desire Guardiola

"Please save my baby"

It was then that Desire heard a gunshot ring out – then felt a sharp stabbing pain in her stomach.

She slumped to the ground in agony, hoping that someone had called an ambulance.

Desire tried not to panic when she realised she couldn’t feel the baby moving anymore.

Once the ambulance arrived, she “begged for them to 'save my baby, to help my baby'”.

“The last thing I remember, I was being wheeled into the emergency room, all eyes were on me,” she said.

“I knew it was serious, I just didn’t know how serious.”

Desire had an emergency C-section to try to save her baby. Source: Desire Guardiola

"They didn’t expect her to live through the night"

It turned out that Desire had actually been shot twice – once in the left breast and once in her abdomen.

She was rapidly losing blood around her uterus, so doctors decided to perform an emergency C-section.

Baby Emery had a heartbeat when she was delivered - but was quickly determined to be brain dead.

Desire woke up from surgery to the unbearable news that her baby wasn’t likely to survive.

“When I first saw her, she was completely motionless and couldn’t open her eyes, cry, or even breathe on her own,” she said.

“They knew there was no hope of her surviving or doing anything on her own. They didn’t expect her to live through the night."

Desire had to make the decision to turn off Emery's life support. Source: Desire Guardiola

“My heart was demolished"

Desire asked for her daughter to be baptised – knowing that they didn’t have much time.

She pushed her own recovery to the side in order to focus on Emery.

Doctors were only becoming more certain that the tiny baby wouldn’t be able to survive without machines.

“This is a decision ultimately up to you. When you do finally say enough is enough, she will be put to rest,” she vividly remembered being told.

“My heart was already broken into a million pieces knowing she was hurt and I could never do anything to heal her pain or make her better.

“My heart was demolished. I felt so confused and hurt and angry.

“However, what one doctor said stuck with me: 'this is a decision you make out of love'.”

Desire held her daughter as they said goodbye. Source: Desire Guardiola

“I held her through each breath she took"

Desire knew that if the decision was just about her – she would have kept Emery with her forever.

But she also knew it wasn’t fair to prolong her daughter’s suffering.

“I knew I should let her go and be free and not continue to suffer,” she said.

“I gave the doctor permission to take her off the tubes.

“I held her through each breath she took.

“We wanted to so badly put her back on the machine, but once you decide, you decide.

“She went peacefully in my arms. I was at a complete loss for words. I never thought I’d be torn from my daughter before her due date.

"I never thought I’d have to experience such trauma or loss.”

"I never thought I’d be torn from my daughter before her due date." Source: Desire Guardiola
